body.p: The Undersigned would represent to your Excellency that at the Augt Term 1859 of the Fayette Circuit Court Dudley Kent was fined $250 for keeping a disorderly house and the undersigned was induced to become his surity on the Replevin bond for the debt. Kent paid the Costs of the judgment and the part coming to the Attorney for the Com'th and procured from B. Magoffin then Governor of the state a respite of the debt for 12 months which respite is dated on the 26th day of Oct 1859 and is on file in the records of the court house. In the year 1859 Kent left the Country & has not been heard of since & is supposed to be dead. Your Petitioner Supposed that the entire debt had been remitted, but the Sheriff recently informed him that he had an execution against Petitioner- for $175 & int.
Your Petitioner is a poor man and it would almost break him up to pay this debt

He agreed to go on his bond, to save him from prison, Kent was a young man who had no fam
ily- and who had borne a good reputation until a short time before this indictment
Your Petitioner begs that your Excellency will remit him the amount of the fine.
We solicit the Governor to remit the fine above spoken of-

Chas S. Bodley
